newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand sees 1996/97 sugar output below target.
newsitem.headline: Thailand sees 1996/97 sugar output below target.

text.p: Thai Cane and Sugar Board Chief Pramote Vittayasuk projected on Wednesday that the country's sugar output for the 1996/97 (November-October) season will not meet the earlier target of 6.28 million tonnes.
Pramote told Reuters that sugar production this season should be close to the 6.03 million tonnes seen in the 1995/96 season.
"I would say the sugar output this year would be around, if not marginally over the previous season's level," he said.
He based his forecast on lower-than-expected yields and sugar cane output.
"The yield is not very good this year and the crop expansion seemed to be limited," he said.

The Thai Cane and Sugar Board had earlier set the 1996/97 production target of around 6.28 million tonnes from 60.32 tonnes of sugar cane, with the yield expected to reach around 103-104 kg per tonne at the end of the crushing season.
But as of February 18, the yield had reached 99.08 kg per tonne, trailing far behind the 103.62 kg per tonne recorded in the corresponding period of the previous year.
